verses.verse: Remember <WH2142>, O LORD <WH3068>, what is come upon us: consider <WH5027>, and behold <WH7200> our reproach <WH2781>.
Our inheritance <WH5159> is turned <WH2015> to strangers <WH2114>, our houses <WH1004> to aliens <WH5237>.
We are orphans <WH3490> and fatherless <WH369> <WH1>, our mothers <WH517> are as widows <WH490>.
We have drunken <WH8354> our water <WH4325> for money <WH3701>; our wood <WH6086> is sold <WH935> <WH4242> unto us.
Our necks <WH6677> are under persecution <WH7291>: we labour <WH3021>, and have no rest <WH5117>.
We have given <WH5414> the hand <WH3027> to the Egyptians <WH4714>, and to the Assyrians <WH804>, to be satisfied <WH7646> with bread <WH3899>.
Our fathers <WH1> have sinned <WH2398>, and are not <WH369>; and we have borne <WH5445> their iniquities <WH5771>.
Servants <WH5650> have ruled <WH4910> over us: there is none that doth deliver <WH6561> us out of their hand <WH3027>.
We gat <WH935> our bread <WH3899> with the peril of our lives <WH5315> because <WH6440> of the sword <WH2719> of the wilderness <WH4057>.
Our skin <WH5785> was black <WH3648> like an oven <WH8574> because <WH6440> of the terrible <WH2152> famine <WH7458>.
They ravished <WH6031> the women <WH802> in Zion <WH6726>, and the maids <WH1330> in the cities <WH5892> of Judah <WH3063>.
Princes <WH8269> are hanged up <WH8518> by their hand <WH3027>: the faces <WH6440> of elders <WH2205> were not honoured <WH1921>.
They took <WH5375> the young men <WH970> to grind <WH2911>, and the children <WH5288> fell <WH3782> under the wood <WH6086>.
The elders <WH2205> have ceased <WH7673> from the gate <WH8179>, the young men <WH970> from their musick <WH5058>.
The joy <WH4885> of our heart <WH3820> is ceased <WH7673>; our dance <WH4234> is turned <WH2015> into mourning <WH60>.
The crown <WH5850> is fallen <WH5307> from our head <WH7218>: woe <WH188> unto us, that we have sinned <WH2398>!
For this our heart <WH3820> is faint <WH1739>; for these things our eyes <WH5869> are dim <WH2821>.
Because of the mountain <WH2022> of Zion <WH6726>, which is desolate <WH8074>, the foxes <WH7776> walk <WH1980> upon it.
Thou, O LORD <WH3068>, remainest <WH3427> for ever <WH5769>; thy throne <WH3678> from generation <WH1755> to generation <WH1755>.
Wherefore dost thou forget <WH7911> us for ever <WH5331>, and forsake <WH5800> us so long <WH753> time <WH3117>?
Turn <WH7725> thou us unto thee, O LORD <WH3068>, and we shall be turned <WH7725>; renew <WH2318> our days <WH3117> as of old <WH6924>.
But thou hast utterly <WH3988> rejected <WH3988> us; thou art very <WH3966> wroth <WH7107> against us.
